body:
Comment 2 by **ajmani**: 
Yes, the package names matching the query appear in the list because of package clauses
in the source code.  I guess what I'm looking for is a quick way to access packages by
typing in their name; there may be a better solution than what I propose here.

I proposed doing this via golang.org search because, on Chrome at least, I can do:
  control-L (moves focus to Location bar)
  gol<tab> -> "Search golang.org:" in Location bar
  time<enter> takes me to the search result page
Ideally, this would take me straight to the time package page, but a search result page
with "package time" near the top would also be great.
